comments.body: Can you use iam_role_facts instead of the sleep to ensure the role exists? You could try until iam_roles in the results is truthy. Besides that, looks great to me.

So, I've tried to use the `iam_role_facts` before making the `ec2_instance` call. 
And it doesn't help in this case, because `iam_role_facts` returns right away with the correct values (I've even updated the modules to also fetch information for instance profiles, and it is correct)

My guess is that even if it's visible in IAM, it's not visible right away in ec2.

I'm not really sure if there is a better way to solve this, than the `sleep` command. I've looked at the ec2 boto methods, and there is none that checks the existence of an instance_profile

~Ah, I see. Possible solution would be to make a customer waiter for iam_role, in that case (https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/module_utils/aws/waiters.py) but this looks good to me as it is.~ <- err, ignore that. That won't work if IAM can access it but ec2 can't. ec2_instance could maybe use a customer waiter but ¯\_ツ_/¯. LGTM.
